#Text=3. Biofilms
#Text=As mentioned above , the most common problems of stents are due to their clogging due to the formation of biofilm and adhesion of biological substances that pass through the stent .
#Text=Biofilm represents the most widespread way of microbial growth in nature and is critical for the development of clinical infections .
#Text=It is produced by bacteria and host products that tend to adhere to different surfaces .
#Text=They create huge colonies known as biofilms .

#Text=Existence in biofilms is for them more advantageous because biofilm provides protection for their cells , maintains a homeostasis , and creates a barrier that isolates bacteria from the surroundings .
#Text=There is extensive communication between bacteria and the effective horizontal transfer of resistance and virulence genes that make bacteria very resistant .
#Text=Thus , bacteria cells in biofilm are more resistant to toxic substances , UV radiation , mechanical damage , bacteriophages , or predators .
#Text=They are also more resistant to the immune system and antibiotics in a human or animal body .
#Text=The surface of the material is very quickly occupied by bacteria because the host products create a biofilm on the material that helps to bind the bacteria .
#Text=This process takes place in five stages , as can be seen in
#Text=Figure 3
#Text=.
#Text=Biofilms affect many medical applications and are a serious medical problem at the present time .
#Text=They are found , for example , in catheters , stents , contact lenses , and many other implants .
#Text=Biomaterials at risk of attaching bacteria together with corresponding body fluids and major components of the host products for bacterial growth are classified in Table 1 .
#Text=The biofilm ’s high resistance to antibacterial agents results in a great risk of infection and therefore creates a very hazardous situation for patient health .
#Text=Microbial cells that live in biofilms have greater resistance to antimicrobial substances than cells that live alone in planktonic form .
#Text=Due to this resistance , the treatment of biofilm infections is very difficult .
#Text=Infected implants must be removed from the patient ’s body .
#Text=This procedure is usually expensive and dangerous for patients because surgical procedures can cause other complications .
#Text=Millions of implants and catheters are used for treatment every year .
#Text=Table 2 shows examples of implants prone to the infections of biofilms .
#Text=For this reason , new materials are being developed to reduce the risk of biofilm formation and infection .
#Text=These materials are based on polymer composites or polymers with surfaces modified with an antimicrobial agent .
#Text=In addition , other options based on physical surface properties such as surface roughening , or vice versa smooth surface , super hydrophobic , etc. should be considered .
